Closing Date: 28 February 2021
Company Profile:
As Cambodia’s longest-serving and only 100% locally owned mobile communications company, Cellcard has more than 24 years of service to the Kingdom maintaining a customer base of more than 4 million subscribers.

Cellcard launched in 1997 in a joint venture with Millicom International Cellular providing its customers with the first prepaid service with scratchcards.

What followed for Cellcard was a number of firsts in the market such as introducing SMS, Value-Added Services, a dedicated Loyalty program, roaming services and a credit sharing platform.

Cellcard is Cambodia’s most-awarded mobile network having achieved more than 30 industry awards for network excellence including an impressive six consecutive Ookla Speedtest awards and a number of category wins from Opensignal including Best Games Experience in February 2020.

It’s most recent market firsts include the Cellcard Network Guarantee launched in 2017 reimbursing any customer who experiences a dropped call, the award-winning App-based Super Data Race held each year since 2017 and its move to lead the esports agenda in 2018 followed in 2019 with Cambodia’s first virtual gamer platform PlayGame and the first tailormade gamer data plan PlayGame Unlimited.

In February 2021, Cellcard revealed its latest innovation, the Pouk Mak chat app, the world’s first major Khmer languaged messaging App.

A major focus for Cellcard now is its evolution to 5G for consumers and enterprise, including Smart City applications across Fintech and web security, data privacy, public safety and security, environment protection, education, healthcare and e-government.

In terms of 5G network readiness, Cellcard has conducted numerous live tests on its stand-alone site reaching speeds of 1.8 gigabytes per second. These are Cambodia’s first and only tests conducted on a real end-to-end with 5G radio to a 5G core network able to accommodate network slicing for dedicated use cases.

A major focus for Cellcard now is its evolution to 5G for consumers and enterprise, including Smart City applications across Fintech and web security, data privacy, public safety and security, environment protection, education, healthcare and e-government.

In terms of 5G network readiness, Cellcard has conducted numerous live tests on its stand-alone site reaching speeds of 1.8 gigabytes per second. These are Cambodia’s first and only tests conducted on a real end-to-end with 5G radio to a 5G core network able to accommodate network slicing for dedicated use cases.

Company Profile:
As Cambodia’s longest-serving and only 100% locally owned mobile communications company, Cellcard has more than 24 years of service to the Kingdom maintaining a customer base of more than 4 million subscribers.

Cellcard launched in 1997 in a joint venture with Millicom International Cellular providing its customers with the first prepaid service with scratchcards.

What followed for Cellcard was a number of firsts in the market such as introducing SMS, Value-Added Services, a dedicated Loyalty program, roaming services and a credit sharing platform.

Cellcard is Cambodia’s most-awarded mobile network having achieved more than 30 industry awards for network excellence including an impressive six consecutive Ookla Speedtest awards and a number of category wins from Opensignal including Best Games Experience in February 2020.

It’s most recent market firsts include the Cellcard Network Guarantee launched in 2017 reimbursing any customer who experiences a dropped call, the award-winning App-based Super Data Race held each year since 2017 and its move to lead the esports agenda in 2018 followed in 2019 with Cambodia’s first virtual gamer platform PlayGame and the first tailormade gamer data plan PlayGame Unlimited.

In February 2021, Cellcard revealed its latest innovation, the Pouk Mak chat app, the world’s first major Khmer languaged messaging App.

A major focus for Cellcard now is its evolution to 5G for consumers and enterprise, including Smart City applications across Fintech and web security, data privacy, public safety and security, environment protection, education, healthcare and e-government.

In terms of 5G network readiness, Cellcard has conducted numerous live tests on its stand-alone site reaching speeds of 1.8 gigabytes per second. These are Cambodia’s first and only tests conducted on a real end-to-end with 5G radio to a 5G core network able to accommodate network slicing for dedicated use cases.

Job Description:
6 MONTHS OF EXCITING EXPERIENCE

The AIA Millennials is an internship program and development platform created for seniors students and fresh graduates who desire a robust and meaningful start to their professional career. The program is structured to equip the participants with the right skill set, experience and exposure in order for them to prepare themselves to become the next generation of professionals in life insurance industry.

We have set out an exciting journey to guarantee that the participants will be adequately and properly guided to build their solid foundation. The journey will focus heavily on your growth through practical exposure and work experience.

•On-the-job learning: the participants will work in assigned departments. Their involvements in the projects are their ultimate assets to enrich their work experience and in bolstering their strength. They will also serve as an effective mirror to reflect their areas for improvement as they progress.
•Classroom and online trainings: both classroom and e-learning are essential constituent of the program to introduce new knowledge and enhance their skills.

In addition to a great opportunity to harvest real work experience at the largest life insurer, you will also receive the followings:
•Monthly salary
•Full-time employment at AIA Cambodia (subject to evaluation after graduation)
•Opportunities to expand your networks as you will be able to work with top talents at AIA

AVAILABLE OPPORTUNITIES

 There are exciting and diverse opportunities in various departments that potentially fit your qualification and interest:

1. Event & Leads, Intern
2. Business Development, Intern
3. Agency Operations, Intern
4. Finance Operations, Intern
5. Actuarial Analyst, Intern
6. Human Resources, Intern 
7. Partnership Operations, Intern
8. Business Relationship, Intern
9. Underwriting, Intern
10. Customer Service, Intern
11. Market Development, Intern
12. Legal, Intern
13. Compliance & Risk, Intern
14. Brand & Marketing, Intern
15. Digital Marketing, Intern
16. IT, Intern

Company Profile: AIA Cambodia is guided by our Purpose to help Cambodians live Healthier, Longer, Better lives. Since commencing business in 2017, we’ve become the first life insurer to provide coverage on 26 critical illnesses. As among the Kingdom’s leading insurers, AIA Cambodia today offers market-leading life solutions for all walks of life ranging from tailor-made crucial coverage plans that include critical illnesses, accidents, hospital allowances and overseas emergency assistance.AIA Cambodia has strived to make a significant, positive impact for our customers and communities. As we look to the future, this commitment is reinforced by our Purpose: to help millions of people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives. Our Purpose guides the decisions we make and the actions we take as an organization — empowering and enabling people to understand and manage their health, while meeting their long-term savings and protection needs. Helping create a healthier Asia is one of the most important and valuable things we can do for our communities, today and tomorrow.AIA Cambodia is the only Cambodian life insurer awarded HR Asia’s “Best Companies to Work for in Asia” for three consecutive years, in 2020, 2021 and 2022. Headquartered in Phnom Penh, the company currently has branches in Siem Reap, Kampot, Kampong Cham and Battambang.

• Experience of debugging (and fixing) live system issues such as slow response times, dropped packets, hacking attempts, general attack attempts, general application bugs, infrastructure weak points and full system outages.

Job Description:
- Performs name and account based research on lists and reports provided through established resources to determine if evidence of money laundering activities exist. Evaluates transactions and customer relationships for money laundering activities, identifies red flag issues, and escalates within the AML framework for further investigation.  
- Maintains familiarity with appropriate investigation techniques to support AML activities, including research utilizing bank systems, intranet, internet and external vendor solutions as appropriate.   
- Provides additional support with the AML compliance organization on more complex issues, including research techniques and capabilities, as well other solutions as appropriate. 
- Maintains relationships with internal stakeholders in the AML Compliance Office and other areas to help ensure research techniques and capabilities perform at high levels.   
- Maintains external awareness of research trends, information, and techniques related to money laundering, and communicates to appropriate levels of the AML Compliance organization. Leadership & Teamwork   
- Effectively communicates within AML Compliance, re-enforcing that knowledge on key information, policies and procedures is understood with all constituents both internal and external.   
- Maintains awareness of AML/ CAFIU/ PRAKAS trends and other related industry practices helping ensure external knowledge and focus is not lost.   
- Helps provide project management support on compliance-related projects and initiatives, as requested, to ensure they progress toward a common goal in alignment with agreed timelines.   
- Provides assistance to other investigators when necessary/requested Operational Effectiveness & Control   
- Participates in special AML reviews, projects, and training efforts, as required.   
- Reports directly to the Compliance Director; Directly supports activities in the AML Operations department.
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, accounting, related field or equivalent experience.   
- Strong interpersonal, organizational, communications, analytical and project management skills.   
- Thorough knowledge of financial products, services, operations and systems and extensive dealing with AML laws/ Criminal Code, regulations and regulatory agencies related to assigned areas.   
- Proficiency with personal computers and pertinent mainframe systems and screening software.
Perks of joining Clik:

1. Room to grow: our senior team is willing to lend guidance to help you improve your skill-set as well as provide you with training resources; and as a start-up there will be plenty of opportunities for career progression. 
2. Fun and dynamic work culture: we aim to hire people who fit well with our office culture, so you’ll be surrounded by like-minded people who believe in the mantra, “work hard, play hard”. 
3. “Silicon Valley” style workplace: superb office, stimulating environment, access to new hardware and software to make your job easier and more efficient while working in collaborative teams. 
4. Appealing bonus and benefits: extensive training, insurance, flexible holidays, cash bonus, phone bill, paternity leave and more - Clik believes in employee welfare.

Job Description:
•Ensuring that bank’s credit principles and policies are followed and complied.

•Responding to queries raised by Credit Risk Management Team on the loan applications.

Job Description:
- Performs name and account based research on lists and reports provided through established resources to determine if evidence of money laundering activities exist. Evaluates transactions and customer relationships for money laundering activities, identifies red flag issues, and escalates within the AML framework for further investigation.  
- Maintains familiarity with appropriate investigation techniques to support AML activities, including research utilizing bank systems, intranet, internet and external vendor solutions as appropriate.   
- Provides additional support with the AML compliance organization on more complex issues, including research techniques and capabilities, as well other solutions as appropriate. 
- Maintains relationships with internal stakeholders in the AML Compliance Office and other areas to help ensure research techniques and capabilities perform at high levels.   
- Maintains external awareness of research trends, information, and techniques related to money laundering, and communicates to appropriate levels of the AML Compliance organization. Leadership & Teamwork   
- Effectively communicates within AML Compliance, re-enforcing that knowledge on key information, policies and procedures is understood with all constituents both internal and external.   
- Maintains awareness of AML/ CAFIU/ PRAKAS trends and other related industry practices helping ensure external knowledge and focus is not lost.   
- Helps provide project management support on compliance-related projects and initiatives, as requested, to ensure they progress toward a common goal in alignment with agreed timelines.   
- Provides assistance to other investigators when necessary/requested Operational Effectiveness & Control   
- Participates in special AML reviews, projects, and training efforts, as required.   
- Reports directly to the Compliance Director; Directly supports activities in the AML Operations department.
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, accounting, related field or equivalent experience.   
- Strong interpersonal, organizational, communications, analytical and project management skills.   
- Thorough knowledge of financial products, services, operations and systems and extensive dealing with AML laws/ Criminal Code, regulations and regulatory agencies related to assigned areas.   
- Proficiency with personal computers and pertinent mainframe systems and screening software.
Perks of joining Clik:

1. Room to grow: our senior team is willing to lend guidance to help you improve your skill-set as well as provide you with training resources; and as a start-up there will be plenty of opportunities for career progression. 
2. Fun and dynamic work culture: we aim to hire people who fit well with our office culture, so you’ll be surrounded by like-minded people who believe in the mantra, “work hard, play hard”. 
3. “Silicon Valley” style workplace: superb office, stimulating environment, access to new hardware and software to make your job easier and more efficient while working in collaborative teams. 
4. Appealing bonus and benefits: extensive training, insurance, flexible holidays, cash bonus, phone bill, paternity leave and more - Clik believes in employee welfare.

Sound like the job for you?

Job Description:
- Prepare analysis of projects to include life cycle cost, materials and equipment selection.
- Manage project issues, budgets, and schedules.
- Coordinate the activities of the design and construction teams.
- Total control over the execution of the project schedule and budget, monitoring the progress of the construction plans, timing and quality of construction work, as well as
quality of materials, products, design approved project estimates, construction rules and regulations, standards, specifications, environmental and safety standards.
- Conformance evaluation of approved design estimates to actual costs of construction work, procurement of materials and equipment.
- Inspection of construction sites: verification of construction work, volume, cost compliance, quality control and analysis.
- Technical acceptance of executed work and executing of all necessary documentation.
- Planning and design solutions that reduce cost and improve technical and economic performance of construction projects.
- Participation in the review, control and approval of design changes made during the construction process, operational decisions in the replacement of materials, specification products, structures (without reducing the quality of construction projects);
- Accounting of completed construction work and preparing  the necessary data.
- Organizing of scheduled meetings on project work.
- Development and adaptation of construction planning
, execution  and monitoring systems
- Acquire equipment and material and monitor stocks to timely handle inadequacies and works closely with purchase team
- Other task assign by General Manager
Job Requirement:
- Master/Bachelor degree in Construction/ Engineering/Architecture or relevant field
- At least 03/05 years of working experience in construction or related field
- Advanced math skills.
- Analytical and critical thinking skills
- Good organizational and time management skills
- Good knowledge of MS.Office, Ms. Project, AutoCAD
- Professional experiences on cross-cultural management and can effectively deal with people
from a very broad range of cultural and professional backgrounds
- Be able to work under pressure with high responsibility
- Has the ability to identify qualified and competent service providers, negotiation skills,
- Coordinate and support the construction hand off to the Construction Project Coordinator
- Be friendly, flexible, honest, hard-working, Creative.
- Good oral and written in both Khmer and English

Job Description:
•Taking the lead in promoting Company’s products and services to potential clients and local authorities.
•Studying to understand policy, procedure, and guidelines related to providing and collecting loans, and guiding credit officer regularly.
•Assessing local market conditions and identifying current and prospective sales opportunities for Loan and none loan services.
•Training Micro Business Loan Officer how to inspect and analyze record and attitude of loan application in order to ensure that such borrowers are truly adequately qualified for loan, as stated in the loan policy, and that they can perform all requirements for loan security.
•Taking part with Micro Business Loan Officer in explaining and educating the loan application about the credit policy and procedure in a way that the loan applicants are aware that the loan including principal and interest shall be repaid regularly according to the schedule in the loan contract.
•Reviewing all loan documents which a Loan officer has made in order to ensure good, clear, accurate, and adequate implementation of the credit policy and guidelines of the higher management before submitting them to higher management for approval.
•Monitoring and following up customer repayment reports daily. In cases where there is a customer later repayment, it is necessary to arrange a Micro Business Loan Officer responsible for accessing the client's residential or business premises so that they can study and solve the problem in a timely manner, avoiding the debt being a serious debt.
•Participating in staff performance appraisal under its direct supervision.
•Managing Loan by follow up the individual staff Performance, Identify the Training need, providing supporting to improve their performance.
•Adhering to high ethical standards and complying with all regulations/applicable laws.
•Reviewing loan reports and perform duties by hiring manager

Job Requirement:
•Bachelor of Business Administration in Management or Finance and Banking or in any related field.

•Promoting and selling the financial products and service to clients

Job Description:
Key Responsibilities:

- Strategic Management:
  + Implementation of Country Procurement Strategy & Categories Strategy
+ Develop the country procurement strategy for 3years
+ Leveraging Coca-Cola System and Regional BIG procurement to develop category strategy
Activated Group Procurement Strategy: 
+ Support the group procurement by providing most accurate and on time information as required for all group commodities and categories
+ Implemented Global strategies
- Procurement Process – Spend Quality
Custodian of the Coca-Cola Procurement Process.
+ Apply rigor in using the Coca-Cola Procurement Process across all categories of spend
Commodities Management & POV:
+ Proactively conduct the Commodity Risk Meeting to hedge commodities as per the BIG directive as a routine a with high degree of specialist skill.
+ Drive margin expansion target through the organization
- Provide procurement solutions: 
+ Ensure continuity of supply while introducing alternative procurement solutions which benefits the company 
+ Ensure stakeholder are alignment before changes in sourcing strategies
+ Ensure agreed customer service levels to internal stakeholders
Business Planning/RE
+ Provide annual budget as per the global guidelines on commodities and categories for Business Plan 3 years.
+ Provide costing for RE purposes with the latest pricing for all materials
- People Development
  + People development & Performance Management:
Drive superior performance and engagement (highest) within CBC
+ Identify training need of staff
+ Provide internal/external training as per individual plan
+ On job coaching to staff
+ Compliance to company training documentation
+ PP conducted twice yearly
+ Train procurement staff to develop their own responsible category strategy
+ Qualify back up MM MC
  + Quality Management & Compliance
- Implement policies/procedure and compliance:
+ Implement Group policies/procedure 
+ Compliance of management routines for SAP 
+ Monitor and manage procurement policies and ensure compliance;
+ Seek approval for deviations
+ Close internal audit weaknesses on time
+ Compliance to TCCQS requirement
- Procurement Report:
+ On time submission of a monthly procurement reports and ad hock reports
Job Requirement:
Requirements:

•	Bachelor Degree in Finance and Commercial back ground is preferred
•	At least 5 Years experiences in procurement in familiar operation
•	Qualifications skills: Analytics, Negotiation skill, Communication, Influencing, Decision making, Contractual Management
•	English – Fluency in writing, speaking and listening
•	Flexible for travelling – in country and overseas
Company Profile:
Cambodia Beverage Company Ltd (CBC) referred too locally as Coca-Cola Cambodia is a leading manufacturer & distributor of non-alcoholic ready to drink (NARTD) beverages throughout Cambodia. With our state-of-the-art bottling plant (commissioned in 2016) situated within PPSEZ, one of the leading Economic Zones in Phnom Penh.

The company produces 16 different beverages, under 8 brands, and within 5 different NARTD categories (Sparkling, Tea, Energy, Water, and Isotonic) which is supplied to our customers throughout the Kingdom.
CBC directly employs more than 850 staff while creating indirect employment opportunities for another 8,000+ staff across the Kingdom.

We are proud that >99.7% of our workforce are Cambodian nationals and that >31% of our staff are female, with women making up 37% of the senior management team. We are committed to increasing our female diversity and are targeting to have 50% female staff by 2030.
We are committed to integrating sustainability into everything we do.

By 2030 we aim to collect and recycle a bottle or can for each one we sell by 2030 and use at least 50% recycled material in our packaging.
We are committed to return to nature and communities 100%+ of the water we use in our drinks and their production. We are working to increase water security where we operate, source ingredients, and touch people's lives.

Job Description:
- Conducts weekly meetings with respective business units.
- Consults with line management, providing HR guidance when appropriate.
- Analyzes trends and metrics in partnership with the HR group to develop solutions, programs and policies.
- Manages and resolves complex employee relations issues. Conducts effective, thorough and objective investigations.
- Provides day-to-day performance management guidance to line management (e.g., coaching, counseling, career development, disciplinary actions).
- Works closely with management and employees to improve work relationships, build morale, and increase productivity and retention.
- Provides HR policy guidance and interpretation.
- Develops contract terms for new hires, promotions and transfers.
- Assists international employees with expatriate assignments and related HR matters.
- Provides guidance and input on business unit restructures, workforce planning and succession planning.
- Identifies training needs for business units and individual executive coaching needs.
- Participates in evaluation and monitoring of training programs to ensure success. Follows up to ensure training objectives are met.
- Performs other related duties as assigned.
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor degree or Master’s degree or equivalent in Human Resources, Business Administration.
- At least 2 to 3 years of experience in Human Resource Management.
- Ability to comprehend, interpret, and apply the appropriate sections of applicable laws, guidelines, regulations, ordinances, and policies.
- Ability to acquire a thorough understanding of the organization’s hierarchy, jobs, qualifications, compensation practices, and the administrative practices related to those factors.
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills. 
- Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.
- Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
- Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Company Profile:
Starting from 1951 in Texas, United States, Circle K is now one of  the most widely recognized convenience store brands, known worldwide for  quality products & great customer service with more than 15.000  associates worldwide including Hong Kong, China, Vietnam, Indonesia,  UAE, Macau, Mexico, Honduras, Guam, Malaysia, The Philippines, Egypt  & Costa Rica…

At Circle K Cambodia, our mission is to be the best and most convenient place for all of your daily shopping needs.

Vision
To be the leading No 1 Neighborhood Convenience Store in Cambodia providing 24 hours conveniences, exclusive merchandise and value added services to our customers.

Mission
To Make Our Customer Life’s a Little Easier Everyday

Core Value
1- Customer Focus: Customer are the reason for our success in Business and we are committed to listen and respond positively to their need.
2- Integrity: Honest, Trustworthy, Adhere to Strong Moral and Ethical Principle and Value.
3- Teamwork: one team, one goal and one direction – with collaboration, share and support each other.
4- Accountability: taking ownership for a task or role and committed to execute and deliver result.
5- Courtesy & Respect: treating other people the way you want to be treated.
6- Continuous Growth: Proactive to Adapt to Instance change.
7- Excellent: Aim for higher quality and accuracy, usually above performance standard.

Currently Circle K Cambodia is having more than 35 Store locate in the following:
- Phnnom Penh
- Siem Reap

job title: Branch Manager ( Banteay Meanchey, Prey Veng, Kampot)
position: Branch Manager ( Banteay Meanchey, Prey Veng, Kampot)
Job Description:
** Overall Purpose
- Responsible for the effective and efficient management of the operations and administration of the branch
- Ensure a high level of staff competency, staff discipline, professionalism and harmony in the branch

** Responsibilities:
- Plan, organize, direct and control the operations and administration of the branch with discretion necessary to fulfill the Bank’s goals, policies, guidelines and instructions set by Head Office and the National Bank of
Cambodia
- Execute signing authority that acts on behalf of the Bank in accordance with operational instruction, authorized
signature book of the Bank issued by Head Office from time to time
- Exercise discretionary powers to approve loans, changes in pricing and terms, continuance of credit facilities and
execution of security documentation of credit facilities in accordance with the discretionary powers granted by Head Office from time to time
- Commit to expenditure within the limits of the budget, approved allocation and in accordance with the
discretionary powers of the Manager for expenditure items issued by Head Office from time to time
- Maintain good relationship with customers by displaying professionalism and to strictly customer/banker relationship and not be placed in positions where one’s interests could conflict with those of the Bank or any of the Bank's customers
- Communicate and maintain close liaison with the General Manager, Heads of Departments at Head Office and all staffs in each branch accordance with policies, guidelines, procedures and instructions relating to operations, control, performance, staff management and general administration of the operations section
- Keep abreast of economic government, monetary and fiscal policies, local and world trends, relevant laws and rules and regulations of the National Bank of Cambodia, Statutory Authorities, Head Office instructions and guidelines
- Achievement of the Branch’s business, financial targets, organizational goals and objectives set by Head Office
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor or Master Degree in business administration or related field
- At least 7 years’ experience in Banking with at least 3 years in a managerial capacity
- Preferably manager with strong all-around experience in operations as well as in credit operations
- Strong command of written and verbal English; verbal and/or written Chinese Mandarin is an advantage.
- Matured, outgoing and with ability to drive performance
- People-orientated and has the ability to interact with people of all levels

Deadline: 12 Feb 2021

** Interested candidates are invited to submit a comprehensive resume together with an Application Form (downloadable via www.vattanacbank.com) with a recent photograph to: Human Resource and Training Department, Vattanac Bank, Level 2, Vattanac Capital, No. 66, PreahMonivong Blvd., Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

Job Description:
Job Responsibilities: 
1.Product Research and Development:
a.To understand the local construction methodology, trends, technologies, products and system through regular site surveys.  
b.Propose the new products within the Group product range based on the construction methodology surveys.
c.To assist group technical team in HQ by providing local requirement, practices and specifications for the new product development. 
d.To understand the local government authority’s requirements /process flow on new construction development.
e.To understand the local code of practice, standard regulations for the products and system.
f.Perform other work-related duties as deemed necessary by the Group Technical Manager.

2.Product Training and Knowledge Enhancement:
a.Ensure all sales executives/Engineers and procurement officer well equipped with technical knowledge of their product ranges through the product knowledge enhancement training.
b.Responsible for development and update of training materials information, documents and training modules.

c.Responsible to Conduct class room training for Sales and procurement department
d.Responsible for the continuous improvement of training courses/modules based the feedback from training participants.

3.Product Demand Analysis :
a.To provide the forecasting of the product ranges in the whole market though the technical studies.

b.To create a model project based on project info and to find out the product demand in upcoming year for all type of projects.

c.Do continuous improvements on analysing method by adding data to get the more accurate values 



4.Product Engineering and Quality Assurance & Quality Control (QA&QC):
a.Responsible for Preparation, revision and maintenance of technical documents, including product drawings, method of statements, test reports and review documents for revisions.

b.To ensure the products and system accordance to authority/ statutory board requirements.
c.Maintain certification and compliance of the existing products
d.To ensure products and quality meet customer expectations.
e.Ensure that all the products are compliance with the KUS Quality management guidelines and policies
i.Responsible for conducting Incoming Quality Check (IQC)
ii.Responsible for raising Non-Conformity Report (NCR)  
iii.Generating/revising the quality related documents, including QIS and QQIS for the related products and systems
iv.Responsible for Other QA&QC related activities
f.Responsible to do competitor sample comparison analysis.   

5.Technical Department Operation :
a.Ensure that all the operations in the department are inbound with the pertinent guidelines and policies of company
b.Writing and revising of the technical operational policies and procedures.
c.To ensure the all enquiries/complaints from the sales executives/procurement officers or customers addressed on time.
d.Responsible to provide product/system technical presentation to the customers in case of necessity 
e.To develop the calculation sheets, templates, formula for improving the productivity.
Job Requirement:
Job Requirements: 
1.Minimum educational qualification/ level:  Degree holder in Civil or Building Construction Engineering.

2.Minimum years of related working experience:   two (2) year experience in building construction site supervision, or equivalent.

3.Software skills:Knowledge in AutoCAD, MS office and structural design software is plus 

4.Understanding of the product application and functions 

5.Knowledge and understanding on local and international code of practice 

6.With initiative and ability to handle work professionally and independently

7.Must be able to communicate both in English and local language  

8.Possess good interpersonal and coordination skills
9.Must be a graduated candidate
Company Profile:
About K.U.S Holdings

Founded in 1999, K.U.S Holdings specializes in the trading of steel bending components, formwork components and architectural works components.

To cater to the needs of different contractors for different type of projects in the market, K.U.S Holdings conducted in depth studies into the manufacturing process and the technical specifications of plywood. The range of plywood has since been expanded, and “Beaverply”, its own branding, was created.

With the added emphasis on efficiency and productivity of the construction industry in Singapore in recent years, K.U.S Holdings have invested into researching the different Formwork Systems globally, as part of the expansion plans to provide an alternative to the conventional formwork methods in the near future.

Over the years, K.U.S Holdings has established itself as an industry leader, and is committed to continue developing and suppling a wide range of products and services catering to the demand of growing construction markets and industries, while adjusting strategically in the evolving construction industry.

Job Description:
** Overall Purpose:
- Install, manage and maintain various bank databases to ensure database system is always up and running in optimization mode
- Install, manage and maintain Oracle SUN System and Oracle Technologies

** Responsibilities:
- Install, manage and maintain various bank’s database platforms and Oracle Sun System including Oracle Weblogic and Oracle Solaris operating system pleat form
- SQL, Oracle database issue diagnostic and checking
- Install, Manage and Maintain Oracle Data Guard
- Attend Testing Database switches over exercise
- Conduct databases and Server Capacity planning
- Recommends solutions by defining database physical structure and functional capabilities, database security, data back-up, and recovery specifications
- Establish the needs of users and monitoring user access and security
- Write database documentation, including data standards, procedures and definitions for the data dictionary (metadata)
- Control access permissions and privileges
- Assist in developing, managing and testing back-up and recovery plans
- Ensure the storage and archiving procedures are functioning correctly
- Communicate regularly with technical, applications and operational staff to ensure database integrity and security
- Database housekeeping, purging and achieving

- Daily backup and restore databases

- Bachelor degree in Computer Science or its equivalent
- At least 3 year-experiences in DBA & SUN System
- Good knowledge and experience in Oracle Database 10g/11g& above, MS SQL server, MySQL, Database Backup and Recovery, High Availability, Tuning and Security
- Experience with Oracle Sun Solaris, Red Hat, Windows Server 2012, Shell Scripting

- Good verbal and written communication skills in English
- Honesty, reliability, and commitment to strict confidentiality

Management Standard

Job Description:
** Responsibilities:
- Follow up issue with the user, Oracle-support and core support team.
- Log issue to Oracle-support by providing the problem description, error log, table rows, screenshots
and spool, etc.
- Coordinate the user for testing in UAT/SIT environment.
- Prepare and schedule testing with the user.
- Generate spool or provide necessary information to Oracle-support.
- Deploy fix unit (database object and patch) into UAT/SIT environment for testing.
- Provide support to end user for in-house application.
- Involve in the project implementation.
- In-house report development.
- Check and review the fixed unit to be deployed into Flexcube production.
- Provide Flexcube support to the users.
- Other Flexcube maintenance and parameterization eg: branch parameter, bank parameter, account class creation, bank code, routing number, terminal Id, CL product, IC product, etc.
- Develop and extract financial data for users eg: loan and finance department.
- Manage Core Banking System helpdesk support team’s troubleshooting work and ensure its service quality. Assist in technical and business side of a problem analysis.
- Help the support team to prepare a test cases to be conducted in the UAT/SIT for a fixes/patches sent
by the Oracle-support before moving to Flexcube production.
- Help report developer to find or confirm a required information sources in the Flexcube database
system.
- Help report developer to analyze the user requirement before start develop the report.
- Keep up to date with Flexcube system architectural components, transaction processing workflow at the components, database object level, frontend functionality and backend object.
- Investigate found user/system problems by performing a root cause analysis, verifying by test case scenarios and collecting required data/log information to be sent to the Oracle support for resolution.
- Organize thorough verifications/tests of a solution sent by Oracle-support in UAT/SIT environment before deploying to production.
- Ensure Flexcube production and test environments data integrity and proper functioning.
- Ensure that all Flexcube related processes (End of Day, Beginning of Day, etc) are smoothly done.
- Develop BI report as per user and business requirement.
- Provide support for all third party applications which are handling by IT Application department.

** Others:
- IT General Support;
- Perform other duties as assigned by supervisor or Head of IT Applications.
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor degree in Computer Science or its equivalent.
- Bachelor Degree in Computer Science.
- At least 4 year working experience in Flexcube system and report development.
- Good knowledge and experience in Flexcube system and BI reporting tool as well as PL SQL programming.
- Involved in the project implementation which related to Flexcube integration.
- Good oral and written communication skills in English.
- Honesty, reliability, and commitment to strict confidentiality.
- Ability to work under pressure.

Job Description:
Job Responsibilities:

• Accountable for full spectrum of company’s finance, accounting, audit and tax function to ensure timely and accurately reporting of financial result.
• Statutory reporting to relevant authorities.
• Direct and manage the processes for budgeting and credit control, investment of fixed asset    management, cash flow projection, financial forecasting and exercise control to ensure capital Operation expenditures are within budgets.
• To support financial facilities arrangement with financial institutions, negotiate for favorable term and compliance.
• Effectively and efficiently working with tax agent auditor company secretary and bankers and all other relevant parties. 
• To provide timely management account, financial report and analysis in synchronization with HQ methodology for decision making. 
• To develop and implement the company policy, procedure in relating to finance. 
• Review monthly forecast and annual budget to ensure timely, reliable and accurate reporting.
• Monitor and analyses monthly results against budget.
• Responsible for strategic financial operation.
• Ad-hoc assignments as and when required.
Job Requirement:
Education:
• Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor’s Degree/Professional Degree/Master Degree in Finance/Accountancy or equivalent.

Experience:
• At least 7 years of relevant financial experience, of which 5 years should be in a managerial capacity.
• Auditing knowledge.

Skills/Attributes:
• Strong technical competence in areas of taxation, statutory reporting, compliance and financial reporting standards.
• Good leadership skills with proven ability to manage and develop a high performing team.
• Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills.
• Excellent communication skills with the ability to interact with other department, related company and top management.
• Attention to details, logical and reasoned approach to problem solving with a can-do attitude.
• Strong computer skills with ERP knowledge would be an advantage.
• Ability to analyze and make improvement recommendations.
Company Profile:
Lee’s Frozen Food, a leading player in the food distribution industry since 1962. Now Lee’s are one of the largest food importer and distributor in the region with operations in Malaysia, Vietnam and Cambodia. We currently employ more than 500 employees with distribution across all major cities in these countries.

We pride ourselves by maintaining products and services of top quality while continuously offering the best products sourced from every continents of the world. At Lee’s we do everything to make it easy for you. We are a company with the buying power to offer our customer consistently great quality and prices across a wide range of products.

Company Profile:
Wing Bank (Cambodia) Plc – the bank for every Cambodian – is driven by the vision to provide every Cambodian with convenient access to financial services relevant to, and for the improvement of their daily lives.

Wing Bank has revolutionized the way Cambodians access financial services by introducing instant, secure, and convenient Mobile Financial Services since 18 August 2008.

Today, Wing Bank serves the entire Cambodian population with 100% coverage of the districts in Cambodia thanks to the innovative Wing Bank App, over 10,000 Wing Cash Xpress agents, over 55,000 merchants, and partnerships with industry giants such as Mastercard, MoneyGram, AliPay, WeChat Pay, Western Union, Visa, and Ria.

Wing Bank provides an array of advanced financial products both for individual and corporate customers. These include loans, deposits, micro savings, credit referral services, money transfers, utility and insurance payments, supply chain payments, payroll services and even phone top-ups. In addition, Wing offers retail payments via “WingPay”, and has also introduced the “WingMall” e-commerce platform.

Both small and large companies alike are now using Wing’s payroll and disbursement services, speeding up their payments. Over 80% of Wing’s agents and 50% of customers are women, making Wing a shining example of gender inclusion in the region.

Wing Bank is committed to providing financial, gender and digital inclusion to the unbanked and the under-banked, allowing every Cambodian to enjoy convenience and security when it comes to financial services

Job Description:
Location        : Phnom Penh with occasional travel to Battambang and Ratanakiri provinces
Salary          : $451 and other benefits

Position Purpose:
The Procurement and Logistics Officer oversees all logistical and procurement activities at Phnom Penh level, including liaison with HQ in Manchester, travel and hotel bookings, management of assets in the Phnom Penh office, importation of internationally-procured items and in-country shipping of  procured supplies.

Specific areas of responsibility:
Procurement
• Action procurement requests for Phnom Penh in compliance with MAG procurement policy
• Liaise with suppliers and service providers to ensure the timely and accurate completion of orders
• When necessary, liaise with MAG HQ in the UK to undertake international procurement and shipping
• Oversee the movement of equipment from MAG UK to MAG Cambodia and from Phnom Penh to field bases; including consolidating consignments and managing all required shipping documents with the Admin and Logistics Assistant and MAG's clearance agent.
• Coordinate with Finance Officer on payment-related issues

General Logistics
• Ensure the Phnom Penh asset register is kept up to date
• Liaise with other departments to ensure the payment of regular invoices (such as rental payments for offices, houses and equipment)
• Advise the Support Services Manager of any upcoming required contract renewals

Management
• Manage and supervise the Administration and Logistics Assistant and the Junior Logistics Assistant, maintaining awareness of their tasks and supporting them to complete well and on time
• Manage and supervise the Phnom Penh support driver, cleaner and receptionist

Responsibilities of all staff
As part of their roles, all MAG staff are required to:
• Uphold and implement MAG standard policies including, but not limited to the Policy on Personal Conduct, Protection of Children and Vulnerable Adults, Dignity at Work, Financial Crime Policy, Gifts and Hospitality Policy and Equal Opportunities Policy
• Understand and uphold the standards outlined in MAG’s Safeguarding Framework, acting with due care and attention to safeguard the wellbeing of anyone that comes into contact with MAG’s work and reporting concerns if they do arise.
• Work within the framework of MAG’s core values, promoting its ethos and mission statement.
• Work towards achieving programme and/or department business plan objectives
• Ensure familiarity with and adhere to all MAG policies and procedures and keep informed of MAG activities
• Undertake and apply learning from appropriate training and development programmes.
• Undertake  the  role  in  a  manner  appropriate  to  the  cultural  context  and  within  the  local  legal framework
• On occasion, work outside regular working hours as circumstances dictate.
Job Requirement:
Essential experience and qualifications
• Graduation from high school
• At least 3 years' work in a comparable role (NGO preferred but not essential)

Essential skills and knowledge
• Proficiency in using Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Word
• Excellent Khmer (written and spoken) and good English (written and spoken)
• Experience of managing a small team
• Good communication skills
• Experience of using databases

Essential characteristics
• Excellent interpersonal skills and demonstrable ability to work as part of a team
• Excellent prioritization and organization skills
• Honesty and reliability

Women and people with disabilities are particularly encouraged to apply.

How to apply: Interested applicants who meet the requirements should submit a Cover Letter and CV with three referees (certificates should not be included with the application and please subject the email with the position you are applying for, Ex: Ms./Mr.  Xxx Xxx is Applying for Procurement and Logistics Officer) to:

Job Description:
2. MISSION
Passerelles numériques Cambodia (PNC) is looking for an External Relations Officer for its External Relations Department. 

S/he will be responsible for company visit management, internship and job placement for students, partnership development, and working on other tasks written down in the section of duties and responsibilities below.

Objectives for external relations 
● Develop the partnership opportunity of PN Cambodia with local companies/NGOs in terms of skills sharing, recruitment and sponsorship in order to support PN mission in Cambodia.
Increase the visibility of PN activities in Cambodia 
3. DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Under the supervision of the External Relation (ER) Coordinator, the External Relations Officer will be in charge of :
⮚ Partnership Building 
▪ Create, maintain and expand a sustainable relationship with companies, institutions, and organizations through face-to-face meetings, participating in external events, organizing guest’s visits at center, etc.
▪ Prospect the Cambodia market in order to identify potential new partners,
▪ Support the local fundraising projects.

⮚ Company visit:
▪ Establish plan/schedule/target companies for study visits 
▪ Request/organize study visit for students
▪ Lead study visits at company/organization
▪ Facilitate the debriefing sessions with students after the study visits

⮚ Internship placement
▪ Place students for four-month full-time internship 
▪ Manage internship follow-up with students and companies
▪ Coordinate the internship tutorship program
▪ Conduct the impact survey with companies

⮚ Job placement
▪ Support and facilitate the placement of students for full-time job 
▪ Collect information on employment follow-up with students and report on results of job placement,

⮚ ICT Market Study
▪ Work closely with the ER Coordinator to perform regular market surveys and specific studies on IT and the job market (once in every two years).
▪ Collect the data, create questionnaires, facilitate interviews,
▪ Perform data analysis and write comprehensive reports including relevant recommendations. 
▪ Formalize and share the understanding of companies needs and the vision of the market with the staff in order to adapt the training to the needs of the market,

⮚ PNCAA and Relation with Alumni
▪ Act as a proactive interface with the PNC Alumni Network and manage the Solidarity Act project.

⮚ Others 
▪ Take part in external relations plan and initiatives,
▪ Participate in yearly/monthly planning input,
▪ Participate in weekly team meeting,
▪ Participate in weekly supervision meeting with External Relation Coordinator, 
▪ Participate in Knowledge management (update our drives and tools),
▪ Organize, maintain and manage contact lists using Sales Force,
▪ Participate in PNC social mission, student selection, and virtual company,
▪ Support project teams and other tasks assigned by the Coordinator. 

To fulfill these objectives and carry out its tasks, the External Relations Officer will get support from the External Relations team.
Job Requirement:
4. SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
▪ Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Public Relations, Sales and Marketing, Communication, or any related field. 
▪ At least 2 year of experience in Public Relations, Sales and Marketing, Communication
▪ Good at English writing skills
▪ Good at interpersonal and communication skills  
▪ Eager to learn, to adapt to new situations and take up challenges
▪ Willingness to work in NGO environment/sensibility to social development problematic
▪ Able to self-train quickly to General IT Knowledge and IT situation in Cambodia
▪ Rigorous, well organized, autonomous and proactive
▪ Able to adapt to different environments and different cultures 
▪ Proficient in Microsoft Office: Excel, Word, PowerPoint, 
▪ Basic knowledge in Photoshop, and another Adobe Creative Suite is a good asset, but it is not a main requirement
▪ Dedicated and Committed to the tasks given
▪ Willing to work in a multicultural team setting (Khmer, French)

5. STATUS AND CONDITIONS
▪ Salary negotiated upon experience
▪ Performance bonus (one month)
▪ Private health insurance
▪ 2 paid leaves entitled per month
▪ Meeting outside the office, event’s participation

6. CONTACT – HOW TO APPLY

Job Description:
2. TEACHING IT AT PNC

Good students comes with good trainers

At PNC we are very dedicated to monitor closely your evolution as an IT teacher in both terms of computer science and teaching skills.
We divide the teaching activities into many roles. Depending on your experience, you will start with one of those roles, and be able to progress step by step to a more advanced one.

PNC teacher roles and evolutions

PNC has a powerful and engaging learning approach. 
Active learning activities such as games, exercises, projects have extensive benefits for students, from critical thinking to project management to self-confidence.

3. MISSION
Your mission is a job that makes sense, in a multicultural team setting. By your daily work you are helping students to escape from poverty.

As a member of the WEB and MOBILE development team you will:
● Coach students individually or by groups on challenges or projects
● Teach to students,  following our active learning approach
● Design teaching material

As part of a continuous learning strategy, you will also:
● Develop internal or external software applications
● Ramp up on various new technologies 

PNC curriculum on WEB / MOBILE development

4. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
4.1. TRAINING  RESPONSIBILITIES
- Design material (games, challenges, projects)
- Prepare and facilitate the courses
- Manage student assessment and grading
- Identify weak students, follow them up closely
- Continuous training (development, self-learning) to master you topics
- Collaborate actively with your colleagues (peer teaching…)

4.2. OTHER RESPONSIBILITIES
- Participate in tutorship, extra-curricular, and placement activities
- Be involved in some project development
- Participate actively in student follow up meetings
- Participate actively in regular team meetings
Job Requirement:
5. SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
✔ Bachelor degree in Computer science or related fields
✔ Proficient  in (at least) one programming language
✔ Knowledge of front-end development (HTML, CSS, JS ...)
✔ Any specialization in mobile or web development would be a plus
✔ Good level of English; reading, writing, speaking
✔ Motivated to work with underprivileged youth
✔ Capacity to understand and explain technical concepts
✔ Flexible, critical thinking, creative and autonomous, open to constructive criticism, with team spirit
✔ Organized, rigorous, good communication, eager to learn and develop himself/herself
✔ Very strong ethical behavior and leadership on his/her area of ownership
✔ Able to self-train quickly to new technologies
✔ Maintain a classroom environment that is conducive to learning by using variety of teaching techniques and strategies
✔ Establish and maintain cooperative relationship with other teachers and staff

6. STATUS AND CONDITIONS
▪ Regular contract
▪ Multicultural team setting (Khmer, French)
▪ Salary negotiated upon experience, performance bonus (one extra month salary based on the year performance)
▪ Insurance covered 
▪ 2 Paid leaves entitled per month
▪ Starting from 27 November 2020

7. CONTACT

company_name: ក្រុមហ៊ុន ម៉េងលី ជេ. គួច អេឌ្យូខេសិន (Mengly J. Quach Education)
Job Description:
• Student Make ID Card
• Student Forget ID card:
a. Issue permission form if students forget their ID card.
• Student Tardiness:
a. Issue late permission form for students.
b. Key in late permission form into Aii Student Affairs System.
c. Counsel students if students are late for 3 times.
d. Contact parents and discuss with parents to improve students.
e. Counsel students if students are still late for 5 times.
f. Arrange an appointment with parents if students are late for 5 times.
• Student Absence:
a. Issue absence form for students.
b. Key in absence form into Aii Student Affairs System.
c. Confirm with parents if students wish to be absent for 3 days or more.
• Leaving Early:
a. Issue permission form if students leave school early.
a. Key in permission form for leaving early.
b. driver if students take school bus.
• Change time to study:
a. Issue permission form if students change their study time.
b. Key in permission form into Aii Student Affairs System if students change their study time.
• Change room or level:
a. Key in permission form into Aii Student Affairs System if students change their room or level. (Only HTs and Assistant Director for SAO can issue the permission.)
• Misconduct Students:
a. Counsel students for any unacceptable misconduct. 
b. Inform parents for misconduct. 
c. Issue Student Agreement for misconduct students.
d. Key in misconduct form into Aii Student Affairs System.
• School Bus:
a. Inform new students about their bus numbers. (only the first week)
b. Inform kid students about their bus numbers in case their bus is changed. (only the first week)
c. Contact parents if there is something change with the bus service.
d. Contact parents if student miss or avoid taking bus home.
e.  Contact students if they intentionally avoid taking bus home.
f. Issue Student Agreement if student miss or avoid taking school bus home.
• Report cards:
a. Keep final report cards for students from secretary.
b. Deliver final report cards when students come to get them.
c. Transfer the rest of the final report card to Admin.
• Club registration:
a. Keep all student club membership application.
b. Contact student club president if there is a new member.
• Contest registration:
a. Give details information about up-coming contest.
b. Make a name list for up-coming contest.
c. Key in student name list into Aii Student Affairs System.
• Study Suspension:
a. Key in suspension form into Aii Student Affairs System. (Only HTs can issue and approve.)
• Parking Ticket:
a. Issue official document if students or staff lost their motorcycle parking tickets.
b. Keep all documents for one day then give back to owners.
• First Aid:
a. Provide first aid to students in case they get minor injuries.
b. Inform parents about the case.
• Sick Students:
a. Inform parents and ask for their approval to take students to Mengly J. Quach Student Health Center.
b. Take students to Mengly J. Quach Student Health Center.
c. Inform parents about students’ health and prescription from the doctor.
• Suggestion/Complaint:
a. Receive complaint or any suggestion.
b. Refer complaint or suggestion to relative departments.
c. Inform the parents about the case in case in need.
• Lost and Found:
a. Keep Lost and Found record.
b. Keep lost things.
c. Return lost things to owners.
d. Issue Appreciation Letters to finders.
e. Prepare Termly Report.
• Guests and Visitors:
a. Record guests and visitors for all department.
b. Contact persons or related departments about visitors or guests.
c. Send Guest and Visitor Report every month to Information Office.
• Fail to punch cards:
a. Keep Fail to Punch List.
b. Key in Fail to Punch List.
• Lobby Monitoring:
a. Monitor the lobby during the break.
• Term Report:
a. Send term report to Head of Student Affairs.
• Student Opinion Survey:
a. Help Admin to key in Student Opinion Survey.
• PTA:
Can be a counselor in PTA.
Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.
Our Benefits:
Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse 
- NSSF and 24 - hour worldwide accident insurance 
- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training 
- Career advancement opportunities 
- Training opportunities for professional development 
- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   012 797 939 hr@mjqeducation.edu.kh #11A, St. 402, Sangkat Tumnup Teuk, Khan Boeung Keng Kang, Phnom Penh. 012 797 939

Company Profile:
Amret (https://www.amret.com.kh) is a leading microfinance institution established in 1991 that contributes to the economic and social development of Cambodia by providing a wide range of financial services to meet the needs of the large targeted customers. Amret has strong commitment and long-term business strategies to be a leading financial institution in the market by deploying ambitious digital strategies. 

Amret belongs to the Advans international group (www.advansgroup.com) a major shareholder and international shareholder (FMO and IFC). The Advans group serves over 750,000 clients, and has expanded its operations in nine countries such as Cambodia, Cameroon, Ivory Coast, Democratic Republic of Congo, Ghana, Myanmar, Nigeria, Pakistan, and Tunisia. 

Amret has more than 150 branches, located in 25 cities and provinces in Cambodia, and successfully serves 450,000 customers with around 4,000 highly dedicated employees.
Contact Info: Contact Information Recruitment and Job Management  092333020 jobs@amret.com.kh #80, Street 315, Sangkat Boeung Kak2, Khan Toul Kok, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. 092333020

job title: Senior Officer, Regional Financial Service Sales
position: Senior Officer, Regional Financial Service Sales
Job Description:
- Sell and promote Amret's packaged financial service products and brand name to potential clients (corporate clients and high-net-worth individuals) in assigned regional offices to raise product awareness and achieve annual sales targets.

- Recruit new VIP biz partners and monitor and maintain existing VIP biz partners at all branches under assigned regional offices to ensure that annual sales targets are achieved.

- Provide services to customers/clients with good communication and ethics.

- Build customer relationships with prospects and maintain good relationships with existing clients (corporate, high class individuals, VIP business partners) to ensure that client satisfaction is enriched.

- Collect customer feedback and competitor information in order to provide constructive comments for the direct supervisor to improve sales success and solve problems for clients.

- Provide coaching on sales skills and tactics to assigned Sales Officers and other salespeople to ensure that they are able to perform their roles and responsibilities effectively.

- Provide support to Savings Officers and other salespeople at low potential branches in sales tactics to ensure that they are able to sell financial services products to corporate clients and high-net-worth individuals and also recruit VIB business partners.
Job Requirement:
- Degree in Sales and Marketing, or related field.

- Minimum 3-4 years in financial services products sales and/or marketing, preferably in finance industry.

- Building professional customer relationships.

- High commitment and able to deal with pleasure.

- Good interpersonal and problem-solving skills and able to work under pressure.

- Good verbal and written communication in both Khmer and English.

Job Description: 1.	Scope of working:Sales Executive is to handle all client inquiries, concerns, and complaints in a professional manner. The Client Servicing Executive’s responsibilities include collaborating with the relevant departments to better address client needs, providing regular updates to higher management, and upselling company products where possible.2.	Duties & responsibilities:-	Cultivating solid relationships with clients through the provision of exceptional after-sales service.-	Creating a positive onboarding experience for new clients.-	Regularly interacting with clients through telephone calls, email communications, or face-to-face meetings.-	Identifying ways to overcome clients' initial dislike of company products.-	Maintaining an accurate record of all existing and potential clients.-	Responding to client inquiries in a timely and professional manner.-	Training and providing overall guidance to client service employees.-	Organizing training seminars to enable clients to fully utilize product features and benefits.-	Ensuring that the correct terms of sale are entered into the client database to prevent avoidable billing issues.
Job Requirement: 3.	Qualification & requirement:-	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Communication or other relevant fields;-	At Least 1-year experience in sales, customer service or hospitality is an advantage;-	Strong commitment to work with wide types of customers;-	Be able to work overtime and weekends on a rotating shift basis;-	Working knowledge of MS Office applications;-	Good oral and written English and Khmer communication skills;-	Good negotiation skills, interpersonal skills, and problem-solving skills;-	Goal orientation and drive for performance;-	Be friendly, flexible, honestly, hard-working, and willing to work as a team.-	Be able to work under pressure with high responsibility.-	Abilities to perform the role and mission travel to provinces when required.

Job Description:
Trade Relations & Information
- Analyze the business model, profitability and needs of trade in order to support management with market knowledge, through monitoring trade development and trade channels. 
- Provide feedback on principal’s brand performance and competitor trade activities and update the information on the regular basis, which includes the following but not limited to situation analysis, trade programs, POSM, and trade communications 
- Regular visits and relationship building with retailers and markets to strengthen brand awareness and product performance nationwide. 
- Analyze results of retail channels, in depth analysis of competition, distribution models. 

Internal Communication
- Develop and maintain positive working relationship with relevant functions of organizations, in order to follow up on critical business developments and trade marketing activities
- Constantly liase with and provide feedback to sales and marketing departments, in order to ensure that targeted messages are utilized in the field force objectives and cycle. 

Policies and Procedures
- Follow TSNR Group policies and procedures and maintain good condition of all company’s equipment and property.
Job Requirement:
- 1-2 of experience in Trade Marketing in FMCG, in a familiar trade marketing role
- Strong communication skills, both written and verbal and excellent stakeholder management skills
- Experience of project management against set deliverables
- Ability to prioritize and organize workloads independently when required. 
- Team player and the ability to work across different multi-media platforms and departments. 
- Ability to problem solve and “make things happen” 
- Willingness to learn and develop with the role.

Job Description: Albert International Academy (AIA) is an international educational organization in Cambodia and our curriculum is based on the International Primary Curriculum (IPC). Job Description: តួនាទី ភារកិច្ច និងការទទួលខុសត្រូវ(Role and Responsibilies):-បកប្រែឯកសាររបស់សិក្ខាកាម និងឯកសារផ្សេងៗ-បកប្រែផ្ទាល់មាត់ជាមួយភ្ញៀវនៅពេលសិក្ខាកាមប្រលងធ្វើតេស្ត និងបកប្រែជូននាយកក្រុមហ៊ុន-ទំនាក់ទំនងជាមួយភ្ញៀវតាមមធ្យោបានផ្សេងៗ(Phone, Email, Social Media)-រៀបចំឯកសារសម្រាប់សិក្ខាកាមទៅប្រទេសជប៉ុន-ការងារផ្សេងៗដែលអ្នកគ្រប់គ្រងផ្តល់អោយ
Job Requirement: លក្ខខណ្ឌនៃការជ្រើសរើស(Requirement):- ទាំងពីរភេទ- អាយុពី ២២ ឆ្នាំ ឡើងទៅ- យ៉ាងហោចណាស់បានបញ្ចប់ការអប់រំថ្នាក់វិទ្យាល័យ- កំរិតភាសាជប៉ុន N3 ឡើងទៅ- ធ្លាប់មានបទពិសោធន៍ជាអ្នកបកប្រែ ឬបង្រៀនភាសាជប៉ុនត្រូវបានផ្តល់អត្ថិភាព- អាចធ្វើដំណើរទៅក្រៅប្រទេសបាន- ចេះប្រើប្រាស់កុំព្យូទ័រ (Microsoft office), Internet & Email និងចេះវាយអត្ថបទជាភាសាជប៉ុន- ចេះភាសាអង់គ្លេស និងធ្លាប់ទៅសិក្សានៅប្រទេសជប៉ុនត្រូវបានផ្តល់អត្ថិភាព- ស្មោះត្រង់, អត់ធ្មត់, និងមានឆន្ទៈក្នុងការធ្វើការងារ-ប្រាក់ខែចាប់ពី $400 ឡើងទៅ-ផ្តល់ជូនអាហារថ្ងៃត្រង់-ឯកសណ្ឋានការងារ- ពិធីខួបកំនើត- ពិធីជប់លៀងប្រចាំឆ្នាំ- ការឈប់សម្រាកតាមការកំណត់របស់រាជរដ្ឋាភិបាល- អត្ថប្រយោជន៍ផ្សេងៗទៀត
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department  081 700 770 / 012 365 777 urg_service@yahoo.com No174 St.21BTZ, Phum Sansomkosal I, S/K Boeung Tom Pun, Kh. Meanchey, Phnom Penh 081 700 770 / 012 365 777

Job Description:
- Designs develop and modify software modules based on functional and system requirements, according to code standards and user interface design guidelines
- Performs program maintenance, modifications and enhancements to existing applications through programming, testing, documenting and training users
- Contribute clean code to ensure a consistently high-quality standard
- Propose and assess solutions to resolve problems, including identifying and evaluating new technologies and third party components
- Understand and execute the technical concepts and the client requirements to ensure the high-quality technical solution
- Understand and be able to explain the roles and responsibilities within the Scrum Team and how to work in an Agile environment
- Provide more complicated automated test method  and understand the test-driven development concept
- Be able to give accurate rough estimations and point out dependencies between issues
Job Requirement:
- Experience in software development
- Proficiency in HTML/XHTML/CSS and HTML5/CSS3
- Knowledge of Object-Oriented Programming with PHP(codeigniter, laravel, cakePHP) and JavaScript, jQuery and Bootstrap
- Knowledge of JSON/Ajax/SASS/XML
- Understand trendy design model patterns such at least MVC as an application of OOP
- Understand SQL commands and ORMs and how to backup and restore a database
- High understanding to client's requirements for the business domain of the product
- Can properly design db structures in accordance with client's requirements (for backend engineer)
- Can review codes for other developers and understand how to write codes readable
- Love to read books
- High level of English communication

** WORKING STYLE
1. Working day and time: Flexible and 15 to 40 hours per week depends on your lifestyle 
2. Holidays: follow the Cambodian national holidays
3. International working style
4. Modern working environment
5. Remote working environment

** BENEFITS
1. Competitive salary and quarterly incentives
2. Innovative and systematic training programs
3. English training program
4. Accident and health insurance
5. Free tea; snacks & coffee (Amazon & monthly free Pizza…etc.)  

Please feel free to contact us to get more great job opportunities and achieve your dream. Interested applicants please send your application to the human resources department and please email recruit@mango-byte.com and visit our website http://www.mango-byte.com/.
Company Profile: We are a web development agency based in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, providing high-quality services to international customers, mainly in Japan. We are eager to develop creative, innovative, cutting-edge technology and businesses such as web services and systems, mobile (iOS and Android) apps, etc. Any engineers and developers interested in the international-standard business are all welcome.Our first goal is to be an international-level technology company in Asia from Cambodia. We want people who want to be international to join us.Mango Byte offers you a career to work with international clients and a great working environment; it’s not just a job; it’s our passion that inspires your life.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department  CS Manager  recruit@mango-byte.com Floor1 at The Link 3 Office, No.32 St.334, Sangkat Beung Keng Kang1, Khan Beung Keng Kang, Phnom Penh, Cambodia

Job Description:
- Create, manage, and execute test plans integrate with release control process (For Senior Position or Lead)
- Analyze and review Functional Requirement Specification or Business Requirement Specification
- Create, review, manage, execute test cases base on above documents
- Author functional test cases for product enhancements and modifications (test scenarios, test cases, test conditions, and test data)
- Conduct manual test execution (Automation if necessary)
- Log defects found in the products
- Work with developers and project directors to resolve defects for new and existing functionality
- Assist in preparing and reviewing the product strategy
- Ensure testing commitments are met
- Identify, communicate and discuss potential impacts or risks with QA Manager
- Able to maintain all QA processes and procedures
- Assist in identifying and implementing new process improvements
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related skill (Fresh graduate is encouraged and welcomed)
- 1-year experience testing medium or enterprise software products
- Proven problem solving and troubleshooting skills
- Pretty good teamwork, communication and documentation skills in English
- Experience using automation testing tools e.g. UFT/QTP, Ranorex, Selenium, Katalon or Coded-UI (Is advantage)
- Understand process of SDLC, STLC and Agile software development methodology
- Experience in web and mobile app development (Is advantage)

❖ Working Style
- Working day and time: Flexible and 15 to 40 hours per week depends on your lifestyle
- Holidays: follow the Cambodian national holidays
- International working style
- Modern working environment
- Remote working environment

❖ Benefits
- Competitive salary and quarterly incentives
- Innovative and systematic training programs
- English training program
- Accident and health insurance
- Free tea; snacks & coffee (Amazon & monthly free Pizza…etc.)

Company Profile:
From a very humble beginning as a small roofing sheet roll former in 1997, ISI STEEL, A member of ISI GROUP, has successfully transformed itself from a family-run business into a midsize corporation leading Cambodia's steel processing industry. With modern processing facilities, world-class management systems and technology, dedicated staff and nationwide distribution networks serving our customers nationwide, ISI STEEL has become a truly reliable and respectable local brand synonymous with quality roofing and wall cladding systems and structural steel products.

This would not have been possible without the strong support of our customers, local and international business partners, our staff's dedication and hard work, and last but not least the government efforts for maintaining the political stability and sustainable economic growth. To ensure our company’s sustainable development and industry-leading position, we are committed to further invest in upgrading our manufacturing facilities, expanding our distribution network, building up our human capital, technology infrastructure, and product innovations to better meet our customer's need and expectation.

While continuing to strengthen our core capabilities in the manufacturing and distribution of quality coated steel products, we have over the years ventured into a number of related diversifications such as pre-engineering steel building fabrication, property development including industrial park, residential, offices and resorts developments, and other construction materials trading business through our subsidiary and affiliated companies to capture the opportunities in the growing economy of Cambodia.
Contact Info: Contact Information Recruitment Team  010-484-535 /092-484-535 recruitment@isisteel.com.kh Phum Tropang Thloeung, St,Veng Sreng ,Sangkat Chaom Chao, Khan Phor Sen Chey, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 010-484-535 /092-484-535

Company Profile:
1. VISION:
“A leading Cambodian social microfinance institution working to achieve positive and lasting changes in the livelihoods of economically active poor families in a socially responsible manner”

2. MISSION:
“To improve the livelihoods, skills, and self-confidence of poor families in Cambodia by providing responsible microfinance and complementary socio-economic services”

3. CORE VALUES:
■ INTEGRITY: 
Chamroeun provides financial services and socio-economic services to its clients to enhance their well-being. It achieves this ethically and with transparent, fair, and cost effective methods. This manner is also applied to Chamroeun’s other stakeholders.

■ QUALITY OF SERVICES: 
At Chamroeun, we believe that our clients deserve tailored as well as efficient services. We provide these services in a convenient, proactive, and timely manner.

■ TRANSPARENCY: 
At Chamroeun, we provide our clients and other stakeholders with complete and accurate information about the terms and conditions of our products and services. Information is provided in a user-friendly manner to enable them to easily understand those terms and conditions.

■ FAIR PRACTICES: 
At Chamroeun, we ensure that the services we provide to our clients as well as the interactions we have with other stakeholders are not unethical or deceptive. We are committed to building relationships that are based on respect, fair treatments, and courtesy.

■ CONFIDENTIALITY: 
Privacy of our clients and other stakeholders is strictly safeguarded and stored, and such data is only used upon their consents, and they are well informed on specific purposes of data usage.

■ NON-DISCRIMINATION: 
Chamroeun considers its clients and other stakeholders as value assets and take all of efforts to make sure that the institution treats them in appropriate manner.
Contact Info: Contact Information Mrs. Nhong Korane  070 960 666 job@chamroeun.com #425, St. 271, Sangkat Toul Tompong II, Khan Chamkarmoan, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 070 960 666
